text: Robert Lloyd (floruit 1600-1625) was a courtier and Member of Parliament. He was Member of Parliament for Ludlow in 1614 and Minehead in 1621.'LLOYD (FLOYD, FLUDD), Robert, of The Savoy, Westminster and Leighton Hall, nr. Welshpool, Mont.' The History of Parliament: the House of Commons 1604-1629, ed. Andrew Thrush and John P. Ferris, 2010 He was a "sewer" or server in the household of Anne of Denmark and later became an administrator, as the queen's "Admiral".'LLOYD (FLOYD, FLUDD), Robert, of The Savoy, Westminster and Leighton Hall, nr. Welshpool, Mont.' The History of Parliament: the House of Commons 1604-1629, ed. Andrew Thrush and John P. Ferris, 2010 He was knighted in 1616. In October 1617 it was said that the queen dismissed him.HMC 75 Downshire, vol. 6 (London, 1995), p. 300. ==References== Category:Household of Anne of Denmark Category:17th-century Welsh people
